content.description:
WARNING: it is illegal and dangerous to climb routes near downtown Pearl St. Any climbing is undertaken at the climber's own risk.

Have you ever been kicked out of the Walrus at 1:55am? Get your life back on track with a potential 40 foot groundfall onto cement. Climb the right or left pod haul starting at the base of the Walrus. This is not your entry level 5.9! Be prepared for some questionable brick :) We are friends with the people who live on the roof so feel free to pop in and say hi!
content.location: Go to the Walrus Saloon on 11th St.!

content.description:
Climb up the best splitter on the West side of Broadway starting with bomber hands for 20 feet. As you climb higher, the crack get bigger, but your hands stay the same size. It goes fists then goes a bit wider. Luckily, some of the brick is incut, and the back of the crack slims down, but this is still a serious solo with BIG consequence that ends in a "bloody mist at the base" - Cedar Wright if done wrong. Get the downclimbing beta from

Front Range Freaks

by Sender Films or have fun and figure it out yourself!

*We have reason to believe this climb is slowly growing wider! Get on it now before it's as good as the

Umph Slot

just up the Canyon Drive (horribly fun offwidth)!
content.protection: 2 - 4 #3.5s are useful. Don't think this crack has actually seen a gear ascent.
content.location: Find the Mediterranean Restaurant on Walnut St., and you won't need to go far.

content.description: Have you ever jammed pure metal, a splitter #2 crack that doesn't change by a millimeter? Walk up the first set of stairs (P1), and pull out onto the face of this early morning, will I say 'Dawn Wall'. Perfect mind numbing jams put your brain into an endorphin fueled chug as you blindly hand over hand your way up as your feet follow along the perfect edges. This is a great climb for those just breaking into the crack game...3 stories of great jams and an easy walk back down the stairs to just do it all again.
content.location: It is across from the Med Restaurant on Walnut St. Look for the grey stairwell!

content.description: Start up just between Art & Soul and Snooze Breakfast joint. Climb the splitter that ranges from offset fingers to fists. Fair warning: Snooze opens at 7am, so try to miss them. The FA cleaned out some concrete chunks from the crack ,so be aware! This is best climbed in a full ninja suit to stay stealthy in such a populated area.
content.location: It is between Art & Soul and Snooze Breakfast joint, right on main Pearl St.
